@fanquake

@laanwj do you have any opinion on passing `--format-version 1` to RCC?

> @laanwj do you have any opinion on passing --format-version 1 to RCC?\n\nNot really. If it improves determinism that's a good thing. I think the only thing to be careful of is that if a new version of Qt adds a new format that is better somehow and differs in more than just this comment, we need to remember to reevaluate this.

@laanwj 
> > @laanwj do you have any opinion on passing --format-version 1 to RCC?
> 
> Not really. If it improves determinism that's a good thing. I think the only thing to be careful of is that if a new version of Qt adds a new format that is better somehow and differs in more than just this comment, we need to remember to reevaluate this.

Do you think the usage of `QT_RCC_SOURCE_DATE
> Do you think the usage of QT_RCC_SOURCE_DATE_OVERRIDE=1 is safer? (see #21654 (comment))\n\nI don't have a strong opinion on it. I think it's fine to change this.
If we're using `--format-version 1`, can't we drop `QT_RCC_SOURCE_DATE_OVERRIDE` ?
Yes! I've overlooked it :man_facepalming: \n\n(from the previous iteration of the pr branch)
Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21654#issuecomment-823347232).
